column4: without any specific knowledge of what gui tool you're using in either OS, I can venture to say that there is a different threshold on what is 'green' between Fedora and Ubuntu; let me suggest you hit the command line and dig deeper into the S.M.A.R.T. status (etc...) of that bad drive
it's the default gnome-disk-utility that comes with both systems
yeah, don't trust the drive, start making backups now
prices are so low these days, its silly to think you should keep that around
when its throwing errors; *trust* me on this one
